019package org.jgrapes.util.events;
020
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Optional;
025import java.util.Set;
026import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
027import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
028
029/**
030 * An event to indicate that configuration information has been
031 * updated.
032 * 
033 * Configurability based on this type of event can optionally be 
034 * supported by components. If supported, a component implements a 
035 * handler that checks whether the paths of this event include the 
036 * component's path in the application's component tree (see 
037 * {@link Manager#componentPath()}). If so, the component adapts itself to the 
038 * information propagated.
039 */
040public class ConfigurationUpdate extends Event<Void> {
041
042    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
043    private final Map<String, Map<String, String>> paths = new HashMap<>();
044
045    /**
046     * Add new (updated) configuration value to the event.
047     * 
048     * @param path the value's path
049     * @param key the key of the value
050     * @param value the value
051     * @return the event for easy chaining
052     */
053    public ConfigurationUpdate add(String path, String key, String value) {
054        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
055            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
056        }
057        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
058        Map<String, String> scoped = paths
059            .computeIfAbsent(path, newKey -> new HashMap<String, String>());
060        scoped.put(key, value);
061        return this;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Remove a path from the configuration.
066     * 
067     * @param path the path to be removed
068     * @return the event for easy chaining
069     */
070    public ConfigurationUpdate removePath(String path) {
071        if (path == null || !path.startsWith("/")) {
072            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path must start with \"/\".");
073        }
074        paths.put(path, null);
075        return this;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Return all paths affected by this event.
080     * 
081     * @return the paths
082     */
083    public Set<String> paths() {
084        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(paths.keySet());
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Return the values for a given path if they exists.
089     * 
090     * @param path the path
091     * @return the updated values or `null` if the path has been
092     * removed (implies the removal of all values for that path).
093     */
094    public Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path) {
095        Map<String, String> result = paths.get(path);
096        if (result == null) {
097            return Optional.empty();
098        }
099        return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(result));
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Return the value with the given path and key if it exists.
104     * 
105     * @param path the path
106     * @param key the key
107     * @return the value
108     */
109    public Optional<String> value(String path, String key) {
110        return Optional.ofNullable(paths.get(path))
111            .flatMap(map -> Optional.ofNullable(map.get(key)));
112    }
113}
